field.comment: a short message describing the action
field.name: message

field.comment: an optional longer description of the log
field.name: description

field.comment: a structured description of the log. you can use this to describe the log using a short, unchanging code. It is meant to describe the action that led to this log.
field.name: code

field.comment: Allows you to correlate this node log to something else, for example another node or a task, a workflow,...
field.name: correlationId

field.comment: The type of log, for example it could be a comment from a user, or an automated action like an email that was sent. The relation between logType and code should be 1-*. Meaning code is the "instance" of a logType definition. Where logType could be "email", the code could be "registrationDetails" or "resetPasswordDetails" or something along those lines.
field.name: logTypeId

field.comment: Allows you to add an attachment to the log.
field.name: uri

field.comment: the server on which it was done
field.name: server

field.comment: The level. You could for instance add "DEBUG" logs that are not visible by default but upon further inspection or ERROR logs that stand out. The default level should be "INFO"
field.name: logLevelId

field.comment: Actor can be null if it is for example an automated action
field.name: actorId

field.comment: Can be linked to an overarching audit log.
field.name: auditId
